definition: grandma (Tw)
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
dialectal or obsolete equivalent of 媽|妈[ma1]/Taiwan pr. [ma1]

sentences.english: To support the children, Granny gets up early every day to work on her farm.
sentences.chinese: 为了扶养孙儿，阿嬷每天一大早起床到农场工作。

sentences.english: But when you are standing before Grandma, you need to speak out bravely.
sentences.chinese: 但是你到了阿嬷面前，你一定要勇敢说出来。

sentences.english: I could tell that she was probably a very affectionate and dependent woman.
sentences.chinese: 知道她可能是一位很会撒娇，很黏人的阿嬷。

sentences.english: My grandmother used to make her own soy sauce for us.
sentences.chinese: 我的阿嬷以前会自己做酱油给我们吃。

sentences.english: Here comes a recycling truck. It takes all of Granny's bottles away.
sentences.chinese: 资源回收车来了，把阿嬷的瓶子都载走了。

sentences.english: Lucy's grandmother loves her very much.
When I have lunch near my office, I often bump into an old old grandma.
sentences.chinese: 我常常中午在公司附近吃饭的时候，会遇见一位阿嬷。

definition: (old) grandfather/polite address for an elderly man, or a woman's father-in-law/(Taiwanese) grandfather
mom/mother (dialect)
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
granny/mother-in-law
(coll.) mother's mother/maternal grandmother
grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
granny
grandma (paternal) (Tw)/(dialect) mother/nurse/amah/(Manchu) father
grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
younger brother
honey (endearment in addressing a little girl)
(coll.) father's married sister/paternal aunt
older female/woman of mature years (Japanese loanword)
(coll.) mother's father/maternal grandfather
aunt by marriage/husband's aunt/husband's father's younger brother's wife
